response.overview: In the near future, after 70% of humanity mysteriously vanishes in "The Great Disappearance", society collapses. Survivors outside government-controlled cities are left in lawless "Exclusion Zones", where the struggle for survival tests the limits of morality and human instinct. Oskar, one such survivor, embarks on a harrowing journey through this fractured world.  In a series of intense, mind-bending arcs, Oskar’s quest for survival becomes a deeper philosophical exploration of the self, identity, and sanity. As he faces the brutality of this new world, he begins to realize that Insane Will Make Me is not just about him—but about all of us. It is you, it is me, it is us.  When the structures that once defined our understanding of right and wrong are erased,  what is the cost of survival when it demands the shedding of everything that once made us human?
response.title: Insane Will Make Me
